page.title: 19Louth Bypass
page.content: In 1955 Louth area Council decided to improve the A16 which runs through the centre of Louth.This idea of widening and straightening the A16 failed to mature as it meant damaging listed buildings in the town.So in 1960 a bypass was suggested to take away most of the heavy traffic.By 1977 8 routes were being considered.In 1980 all of these were shelved due to lack of funds.In 1982 public pressure caused the plans to be reconsidered.The present plan is to begin construction in 1988 and for completion by 1990.Our poll showed the majority thought that there was too much traffic in the narrow streets,damaging buildings and making them unsafe.70% of the people agreed that the proposed route,which joins the A16 just north of Louth, bypassing to the west and rejoining the A16 at Kenwick Bar, was best.
